column4: i did the directions i found on ine but no love
yea
i did that and th directions from ati's site
i have a monitor out of range error onmy monotor
after doing the install
https://wiki.ubuntulinux.org/BinaryDriverHowto/ATI  is where i followeed directions from
but its not working
what can i do now..
which method did you use?
the repos?  you might need to use the proprietaryfglrx dirver (via ati.com or seveas' repos)
did you do the other steps?
i.e. change from ati to fglrx in xorg.conf?
restarted X?
can you get to a prompt?
cat /etc/X11/xorg.conf | grep Driver | tail -1
does fglrxinfo say ati or mesa (don't paste it here)
that means it's not using the fglrx driver
is this a 32bit sys.?
but is' not a 64bit install?
sudo apt-get remove whatever that fglrx package is called, then use the seveas' repos method described on the ati wiki to get a newer verrsion of fglrx
run it in terminal. look for error output
read the ati wiki page and search for "seveas"
